thread.title: This man tried to rape a woman as she lay unconscious in an alleyway - he ran away, leaving her collapsed in the pouring rain
thread.title_full: This man tried to rape a woman as she lay unconscious in an alleyway - he ran away, leaving her collapsed in the pouring rain

author: Rebecca Day
title: This man tried to rape a woman as she lay unconscious in an alleyway - he ran away, leaving her collapsed in the pouring rain
text:
Khadimou Diagne has been sentenced to seven years in prison for trying to rape a woman in an alleyway. Share Get daily   
A man who tried to rape a woman as she lay unconscious in the street has been jailed. 
The 38-year-old victim was walking through Wigan town centre at about 5am, when she was befriended by attacker Khadimou Diagne. 
The pair walked along Central Park Way and down an alleyway that leads to the side of The Royal Oak pub on Standishgate, when the woman suddenly collapsed and fell unconscious. 
Unable to bring her to her feet, Diagne dragged her comatose body by the arms back into the alleyway, before he took her clothes off and tried to rape her. Read More The twisted Facebook lie that has put two women in jail, and left their 'friend' dead 
He then ran away, leaving the victim in the alleyway in the pouring rain, before a passerby found her and called for an ambulance. 
The attack, on October 1 last year, was captured on CCTV, and later that month, an-off duty inspector recognised Diagne from the footage on another road in Wigan. The Royal Oak, on Standishgate - the woman was walking down an alleyway that leads to the pub when she collapsed 
He was arrested, and initially denied any involvement in the incident. 
When he appeared at Bolton Crown Court, Diagne pleaded guilty to attempted rape. Read More The evil pimp and his aunt, who forced desperate young mums into Manchester's red light district 
The 33-year-old, of Swinley Road, Wigan, has now been sentenced to seven years in prison at Bolton Crown Court, and will remain on licence for the following four years. He will also remain on the sexual offenders register for life. 
Det Con Brendan Greally of GMP’s Wigan team, said: “This was a despicable attack on a lone woman and the callous manner in which he carried out this crime and then left her unconscious in the street, demonstrates the kind of individual he is. 
“Everyone should be able to go about their daily lives without fear of being raped and I hope this result brings some comfort to the victim following the chilling ordeal she was put through, knowing her attacker is behind bars, unable to cause any further harm.” Like us on Facebook
